Reviews.Title: Good basic phone
Reviews.Author: Douglas Bryan
Reviews.Content: Not really interested in a smart phone yet?  This is a good basic telephone.  The compact size along with a QWERTY keyboard makes this an easy to use phone for basic needs.

Reviews.Title: Decent feature phone, held back by bad software design, and annoying Verizon software
Reviews.Author: Josh H-G
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I don't especially care about having a smartphone or a data plan. I just want to make occasional calls, texts, and possibly take a picture once in a while.This phone does all of that respectably.Call quality is good. Not as nice as many Nokia phones I've owned over the years, but definitely not bad.Texting is easy enough on either keyboard, but not great on either as well.I've had my phone for about a year and a half now. I drop it relatively frequently, and while I have some scuffs, mine has been operating dependably the entire time. I think it's durable enough for most people, but it is not the most rugged phone you could purchase either.After a year and a half, my battery life is still good, too. I am a light user, but I generally only have to charge every 2-4 days depending on what i've been doing. More use means every other day generally, less means I can get to 4 days or so sometimes. Battery life is still good after this long.It is small enough to pocket comfortable, and large enough to hold comfortably as well.The camera is pretty unimpressive. It will take a picture, but you're really best to not try unless you've got a lot of good daylight. Even with the best conditions, you'll still get an okay picture at best.The real reason I would only give this phone low marks is the combination of questionable software design on LG's part, and the really annoying additions that Verizon made to make things even worse. What could be a decent feature phone is mostly marred by bad software design and intrusion by Verizon. Nothing so bad that the phone is unusable, but it can be quite frustrating.

Reviews.Title: just what i wanted
Reviews.Author: Pamela J. Murphy
Reviews.Content: this is the perfect phone for my needs...i have had really good luck with LG phones and i did NOT want a touch screen. just had it programed and all is well. thank you!

Reviews.Title: Great simple phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is great simple phone. I bought it for my senior father & he can navigated it very easy.  The shipping was very fast & the company included a free car charger which I wasn't aware they were going to do, so it was very nice surprise! Thank u!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: scryerky
Reviews.Content: I loved my old slid phone and this newish phone is a great replacement. The overall size and the button were a bit small but it is great for me and for those who want a gradual upgrade from a basic flip phone.

Reviews.Title: love the phone
Reviews.Author: Elaine Trufant
Reviews.Content: I got the phone in timely fashion....Love the phone.  Needed it to replace a previous one that I broke  very happy

Reviews.Title: Terrible, Slow Phone
Reviews.Author: Ian Thomas
Reviews.Content: The LG Cosmos 2 is a very terrible phone. It lags all the time, randomly opens up apps, the call quality is bad, and has a bad camera. The only feature that was good, was the slide out qwerty keyboard. I do not recommend buying this phone.
